Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the relationship between James Comey and Robert Mueller, stating that they are "best friends" when they are actually former colleagues with a work-related friendship.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to prove that the friendship between Comey and Mueller presents a conflict of interest in the Russia investigation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that a friendship between Comey and Mueller automatically creates a conflict of interest, without considering other factors or legal guidelines.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge that Comey did not appoint Mueller and had been fired from his position at the FBI before Mueller was brought on board by Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein. This alternative explanation undermines the claim of a conflict of interest.
